revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Huawei |model=B593u |revision=-12 |asin= |fcc_date=06/05/2012 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=now |type=CPE, LTE router, LTE modem |fcc_id=QISB593U-12 |pcb_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM5358U |cpu1_cspeed=500 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe, USB 2.0, |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM5358U |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module=Huawei EM920u-12 |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi2_chip1_model=MDM9200 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=LTE |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags=4G LTE, |stock_os=Linux;2.6.21.5; |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=WLAN1-XXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^WLAN1-[A-F0-9]{6}$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user= |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|LTE CPE B593}} "B593RW2A VER.B RF" is on the back of the board. :This device has a Mini PCIe slot. It is likely USB only. "MD1EM92012UM" and "VER.A RF" is on the Mini PCIe (LTE) wireless module. :The module is using RTR8601 and PM8028.. (w/ [[Qualcomm]] MDM9200) The device appears to support the following cellular bands and modes.. *2G: EDGE/GPRS/GSM - 850/900/1800/1900 MHz *3G: HSUPA/HSDPA/UMTS/DC-HSPA+ - 900/2100 MHz *4G: LTE FDD - 800/900/1800/2100/2600 MHz .. but, this is probably at least partially wrong. *[https://www.phcorner.net/threads/674166/ ''Tutorial: Huawei B593u-12 unlock'' on '''PhCorner'''] *[http://forum.ixbt.com/topic.cgi?id=17:45949-57 Stuff on ixbt.com's forums about the device] (RU) • [https://deviceatlas.com/device-data/devices/huawei/ ''DeviceAtlas''] 
cat ./cpuinfo
system type	: CHIP95358
processor	: 0
cpu model	: MIPS 74K V4.9
BogoMIPS	: 248.32

Linux version 2.6.21.5
Name B2000
Hardware version Ver.B BCM5357
Software version V100R001C35SP061

^VERSION:EXTH:EM920MD1EM92012UM Ver.A
^VERSION:INTH:EM920u-12MD1EM92012UM Ver.A
 *[http://www.huaweidevice.com/worldwide/downloadCenter.do?method=toDownloadFile&flay=software&softid=NDcxMDA= GPL code for the B593u-12]. This GPL code from Huawei is a samba source tree flattened into one dir. :According to the "LTE CPE Online Help" the router runs with Open BSD, :which is not GPL-licensed. Additional specs... *Dimensions: [[Dimensions::190 mm x 35 mm x 176 mm]] *Weight (in grams): [[Weight (grams)::500]] ===[https://www.4gltemall.com/huawei-b593-4g-lte-cpe-industrial-wireless-router.html Models]=== * B593u-12: LTE Band 1/3/7/8/20 (FDD 800/900/1800/2100/2600MHz) * B593s-22: LTE Band 1/3/7/8/20/38 (TDD 2600, FDD 800/900/1800/2100/2600MHz) * B593s-82: LTE Band 38/40 (TDD 2300/2600MHz, FDD 800/1800/2600MHz) * B593u-91: LTE Band 38/40 (TDD 2300/2600MHz) (• B593u-41, B593u-513) * B593u-501: LTE Band 4/17 (GSM850/1900, WCDMA Band V/IV/II) * B593s-516: LTE Band 2/4/5/7/8 (FDD 850/900/1900/AWS/2600MHz), : 3G UMTS (850/900/1900/AWS), 2G EDGE (850/900/1800/1900MHz) * B593s-601: LTE Band 3/7/40 (FDD 1800/2600MHz, TDD 2300MHz)) * B593s-850: LTE Band 38/39/40 (TDD 1900/2300/2600MHz) * B593s-931: LTE Band 3/38 (FDD 1800MHz, TDD 2600MHz), : 3G UMTS (900/2100MHz), 2G EDGE (850/900/1800/1900MHz) ===Vendors=== *[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2SAM2cFOeQM '''Telekom Speedbox LTE (Huawei B593u-12) - Unboxing''' on '''YouTube''' (DE)] :Label shot shows the device with a default SSID pattern of '''WLAN1-XXXXXX''' :(which jives with the FCC sample label). The password (both HTTP interface and WPA PSK) appears to be randomly generated. :This device is used by '''Deutsche Telekom''' ([http://www.telekom.com/static/-/105308/3/technical-data-Speedbox-LTE-si.pdf Datasheet]). Operators using the device.. (per [https://sites.google.com/site/ltedepot/home/ue/gateways/huawei-b593u-12-2012-08 ltedepot]) ;Australia *'''Optus 4G''' (2012-08) ;Bahrain *'''STC''' (Saudi Telecom Group) ;Germany *'''Deutcsh Telekom''' (per above '''YouTube''' video), :aka. '''Telekom Speedbox LTE''' *'''Vodafone''' ;Lithuania *'''Tele2''' (2013-03) ;Poland *'''T-Mobile''' ;Saudi Arabia *'''Zain''' ;Singapore *'''M1''' (2013-03) ;Sweden *'''Tele2''' (2012), operator branded version *'''teliaSonera''' (2012), operator branded version __NOTOC__
